tweets.html:
Said it before and I'll say it again, Aaron Sorkin is your parents' Joss Whedon.

— Vince Mancini (@Filmdrunk) June 26, 2012

Just watched Moffat's "Blink." I'll be quitting now. I know when I've been whipped.

— josh friedman (@Josh_Friedman) June 27, 2012

You don't see much of David Blaine these days. Is that because of some ongoing, mind-blowing invisibility trick that no-one cares about?

— Paul Whitelaw (@paulwhitelaw) June 27, 2012

People who have Breaking Bad screeners: I love you, but kindly shut the heck up. Signed, Jealous in Nashville.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 27, 2012

Hey TBS - you were basically created to be a Nora Ephron tribute channel, so could you please get on planning a movie marathon? Thanks.

— brooke_edge (@brooke_edge) July 1, 2012

Dawson Leery is a teenaged Ted Mosby.

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) June 30, 2012

In a move that's Breaking Balls, Dish Network is dropping AMC today. No BB, Mad Men, Walking Dead, Killing. Time to do some Breaking Dishes!

— Bryan Cranston (@BryanCranston) June 30, 2012

Theory: Jon Hamm's approach to playing Don Draper is that the inside of his brain itches and he can't scratch it.

— John Moe (@johnmoe) June 30, 2012

Fail-Safe is to Strangelove as Studio 60 is to 30 Rock as The Newsroom is to something I can't wait to see.

— Rian Johnson (@rianjohnson) June 30, 2012

Tyler Perry's Madea In The Most Comfortable Of Her Three Pairs Of Fuschia Slacks

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) June 30, 2012

TV would lead you to believe that literally bumping into someone you find sexy is a common occurrence. The key is to be carrying books.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) June 30, 2012

Hey, this episode of #TheFirm is CRAZY AWESOME! #TheOnlyPersonTweetingTheFirm

— Mark W. (@marqualler) July 1, 2012

You know part of NBC's severance package when they cancel your show is a guest star on SVU.

— Tess Rodham Rafferty (@TessRafferty) July 1, 2012

I desperately need to find a summer camp that is #prettyLittleLiars themed. Minus me getting hit w/ a car.

— John Lowe™ (@TheJohnLoweShow) July 1, 2012

Supreme Court decides not to fine CBS for Janet Jackson Super Bowl show. Still considering death penalty for Black Eyed Peas.

— Mike Scully (@scullymike) July 1, 2012

Matthew Bomer is criminally underused in Magic Mike, which is otherwise the best film in the history of cinema.

"The lesson to take from Magic Mike's success is that audiences want films with nearly all-male casts." - studio executives

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
You think Taylor Kitsch is purchasing a Channing Tatum voodoo doll?

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) July 1, 2012

Magic Mike would have thrived in the hands of a better actor like Philip Seymour Hoffman.

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) July 2, 2012

Working on gay version of "Magic Mike". Tentative title: "Magic Michael".

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) July 2, 2012

With Nora Ephron gone, it's up to Nancy Myers to make a movie about Nicole Kidman helping Katie Holmes organize her new life/walk-in closet.

— Adam Sacks (@AdamSacks) June 29, 2012

TMZ reporting that Church of Scientology is stalking Katie Holmes, which totally interferes with their ability to stalk Katie Holmes.

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) July 1, 2012

TMZ reports that Scientology is now tailing Katie Holmes, something Tom Cruise never showed much interest in.

— Scott Chernoff (@ScottChernoff) July 1, 2012

Twitter is filled with people arguing over Spain vs. Italy. Personally, I think Italian wines are better. (Wait, what are we doing?)

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 1, 2012

This match has a CBBC commentary but not a Cbeebies commentary? Bit ageist

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) July 1, 2012

The CBBC commentary team are calling each other cheeky monkeys. One of them shouted "WOO HOO" at kickoff. This is incredible.

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) July 1, 2012

Meanwhile, on the CBBC commentary, a discussion about who has the best haircut, because one of the commentators just had a haircut

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) July 1, 2012

CBBC commentary genuinely has this guy doing analysis: pic.twitter.com/LvOe5yGF

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) July 1, 2012

The CBBC team are arguing about who has the most friends now. I want CBBC to commentate everything

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) July 1, 2012

CBBC just missed the halftime whistle because they were trying to make a toddler chant "SPAIN SPAIN SPAIN!"

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) July 1, 2012

Why ESPN just went out RT @bhofheimer_espn: Big storm rolling through Bristol now.

— Alana Russo (@alanarusso) July 1, 2012

And *this* is why playing the #Euro12 Final in Bristol was a bad idea. #espn

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 1, 2012

ESPN just pulled a "final shot of #TheSopranos" on its #EURO2012 coverage. Very bold choice.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 1, 2012

The good news: ESPN once again has power. The bad news? All the dinosaurs on the Bristol campus are now loose. #Euro2012Park

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 1, 2012

I've maintained for a while that Americans are going to really start paying attention to climate change when it involves losing sports.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) July 1, 2012

Spain has a 2-0 lead over Italy in soccer. I'm assuming this is why my pizza still hasn't been delivered. #Euro2012

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) July 1, 2012

Really not so bad for Italy. Spain fans have to eat small tapas in celebration while Italians have huge portions of chicken parm. #euro2012

— Stuart Levine (@Stus_Views) July 1, 2012

ESPN hosts wld make great political speechwriters. "Please watch the suspense-free 2nd half" becomes "Pull up a chair for history" #Euro2012

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) July 1, 2012

Can't wait to find out that #Euro2012 blackout was a badly-conceived promotional stunt for NBC's #Revolution.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 1, 2012

Tip: If power's out and device batteries dead, the square things are called books and the moving shapes are other humans.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) July 1, 2012

Reading Paula Deen's moving autobiography, I Can't Believe I'm Not Butter.

— Michael McKean (@MJMcKean) July 1, 2012

tweets.html:
I have a terrible feeing that I missing some important TV premiere tonight. #firstworldanxiety

If Michael Phelps really wanted a challenge, he'd swim in the Winter Olympics.

— Steve Hofstetter (Sacramento Jan 4-6) (@SteveHofstetter) July 2, 2012

When the Meth heads show up on #BreakingBad, I sometimes wonder if I’ve started watching an episode of #TheWalkingDead by accident.

TEAM MATTY. Also I'm crying a little. #Awkward

— Louis Peitzman (@LouisTalksTV) July 2, 2012

When I feed this kitten he gazes at me with the same adoration Sean Hannity reserves for Sarah Palin's in-studio visits.

— John Fugelsang (@JohnFugelsang) July 2, 2012

Just watched an episode of FAWLTY TOWERS on PBS, which is something I've pretty much been able to do for 30 years, now that I think of it.

— Keith Phipps (@kphipps3000) July 2, 2012

Maybe Spielberg made Schindler's List out of guilt for producing every Back to the Future movie & never suggesting that Marty kills Hitler.

Is it unkind to say Alec Baldwin's yoga instructor/wife must not be a very good yoga instructor if he's still that bloated and rage-filled?

There had better be a vampire on the screen in the next ten seconds, because I do not watch #TrueBlood for Iraq war commentary.

I care about, maybe, 2% of what’s happening on #TrueBlood this season. Maybe.

Watching the BET Awards. Looking forward to the Nora Ephron tribute.

Hey East Coast: I'm recording the BET awards so please refrain from tweeting whether they were on or off the hook! #Spoilers

Jamie Foxx look like Fredrick Douglass.
😂😂😂

Man, Billy Crystal is doing a great job hosting the #BETAwards

There is more crotch grabbing in the first five minutes at the #BETawards than the entire movie of #MagicMike!

No but seriously, fuck Chris Brown

— Best Coast (@BestCoast) July 2, 2012

Chaka kind of looks like a gay man's couch exploded. #BETawards

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 2, 2012

Hope The Newsroom covers Balloon Boy tonight.

— Bob Powers (@bobpowers1) July 1, 2012

Tonight on #Newsroom, the cat and I watch Zoolander.

— Julie Klausner (@julieklausner) July 2, 2012

Finally watching the first episode of #TheNewsroom. I feel like I'm on an unpopular dodgeball team when I say: I like it. Season pass set.

— Jo Garfein (@jopinionated) July 2, 2012

If you pretend that #Newsroom is actually a show about an experimental form of group role playing therapy with lunatics, it's much better.

— John DeVore, Wellness Guru (@JohnDeVore) July 2, 2012

"He's not an ass." Uh, I beg to differ. #Newsroom

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 2, 2012

I'm beginning to miss it when Aaron Sorkin was merely sanctimonious on The Newsroom.

— Phil Rosenthal (@phil_rosenthal) July 2, 2012

Can McKenzie fall down an elevator shaft now? Wow, she is gawd awful. #Newsroom

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) July 2, 2012

I don't think I have never used this before, but: #headdesk. #Newsroom

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 2, 2012

GUYS, EMAIL WAS REALLY HARD IN 2010. #Newsroom

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 2, 2012

Sorky, I know you're scurred of "innernet girls" & "globs" but Id "Alta Vista" what "E-Mails" is b4 using it as a "hackneyed plot device"

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) July 2, 2012

On "The Newsroom" Emily Mortimer texted a mass e-mail meant to be private using the new iPhone "Plot Contrivance" app.

— Frank Conniff (@FrankConniff) July 2, 2012

"E-mail? I invited my postal serviceman in for drinks every day! This is bullshit!" #OldManSorkin

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) July 2, 2012

If the goal of "The Newsroom" is to be boring except when it makes me cringe due to the incessant preaching, it is a smashing success.

— 🎄Chris Wilson🎄 (@realchriswilson) July 2, 2012

After women have a business meeting they always spend at least five minutes afterward discussing their man problems. We just do! #Newsroom

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 2, 2012

@TVandDinners Wait. Wait. Is that before or after the pillow fight?

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) July 2, 2012

@AndyDaglas During! Wheeeee!

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 2, 2012

And Aaron blaming it on women drivers RT @hriefs @phil_rosenthal It’s like watching a car crash happen before your eyes. #newsroom

— Phil Rosenthal (@phil_rosenthal) July 2, 2012

If Aaron Sorkin created Twitter, the character limit would be 144,000.

— jon gabriel (@exjon) July 2, 2012

If Jeff Daniels kids from the Squid & The Whale showed up in the Newsroom, I would watch. #okayquestionmark

— Channel11News (@Channel11News) July 2, 2012

I liked that show. That show in the karaoke bar. More of that show, please. #Newsroom

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 2, 2012

I figured out how to fix #Newsroom. Are you ready? Make it a musical. Not like Smash, like Cop Rock. IT IS ITS ONLY HOPE. I'm DEAD serious.

— Julie Klausner (@julieklausner) July 2, 2012

Realize this, Sorkin. You're not Chayefsky, you're not James L. Brooks. You are sporadic Bochco, at best. Make. Your. Cast. Sing. #anddance

— Julie Klausner (@julieklausner) July 2, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
The Newsroom gives me a headache.

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) July 2, 2012

Do you think directors refuse to work with Allison Pill sometimes because her charisma is too enormous to contain or shape?

— Julie Klausner (@julieklausner) July 2, 2012

NEWSROOM appears to be as thoughtful about its female characters as STARSHIP TROOPERS was about the bugs.

— Adam Bonin (@adambonin) July 2, 2012

"Back in my day, everything was the woman's fault!" #OldManSorkin

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) July 2, 2012

Female leads named "Mac" are always plucky. But "MacKenzie McHale"? I'm just not sure that my TV can handle that amount of pluckiness.

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 2, 2012

My Twitter feed mirrors our multicultural society; half chewing over latest ep. of HBO's The Newsroom, the other half loving on BET awards

— Eric Deggans at NPR (@Deggans) July 2, 2012

Fairly convinced Sorkin only does TV so that he can write female characters that he can have sexual fantasies about.

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 2, 2012

Sorkin writes his own fanfic: a plucky, self-righteous blonde & her friendless, self-righteous boss both fall for the same TV writer...

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 2, 2012

@fymaxwell @BittrScrptReadr So Sorkin is basically our generation's Ayn Rand?

— Aaron Bulger (@speakingjargon) July 2, 2012

"Ladies, no need to fight. I've got enough righteous indignation to satisfy both of you," said the writer. (Excerpt from Sorkin's Fanfic)

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 2, 2012

I bet Dev Patel wandered onto the set of The Newsroom one day, and someone just told him to hang around, that maybe he'd get a line or two.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 2, 2012

Dear #newsroom , please stop showing assistant girl and mop haired tie guy THEY FUCKING ARE ANNOYING AND I LIKE THE REST OF THE SHOW.

— kevinbiegel (@kbiegel) July 2, 2012

Every ep of Newsroom should begin with Sorkin watching MSNBC while eating tortilla chips. Then a slow Coen Bros. style push in to his ear.

— Brandon David Wilson (@Geniusbastard) July 2, 2012

Olivia Munn's #Newsroom character is called Sloan Sabbith? Where does she come from, Coruscant?

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) July 2, 2012

After 2 episodes, I think the biggest problem with The Newsroom is Aaron Sorkin thinking Will McAvoy really is a hero, instead of a jerk.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 2, 2012

Yes, be integrity and all that, but the real fantasy Newsroom sells is a world where TV producers makes references to the way Shaw looks.

— Jason Zinoman (@zinoman) July 2, 2012

I am watching tonight's #Newsroom again just to make sure I didn't dream it.

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) July 2, 2012

One thing I do approve of, re: The Newsroom, is the weekly moment where Sam Waterston threatens to commit acts of physical violence.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 2, 2012

I'm glad that America, across all sides of the political aisle, in these divisive times, can unite in its disdain for THE NEWSROOM.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 2, 2012

Chris Messina just walked in. #TheNewsroom is saved, right?

— Kim! (@vaupelganger) July 2, 2012
